meta.title: Daniel Alconchel — Data Engineer & Developer
meta.description: Personal portfolio of Daniel Alconchel. Data Engineer with interest in DevOps and Cloud.

hero.name: Daniel Alconchel
hero.description: Computer Science & Mathematics graduate from the University of Granada. I build data pipelines and I'm interested in cloud infrastructure.

about.title: About me
paragraphs: I'm a data engineer with a strong mathematical background, holding a double degree in Computer Science and Mathematics from the University of Granada. My experience spans ETL pipelines, big data processing, semantic models, and business intelligence.

Although my career has been focused on the data world, my real interest extends to DevOps and Cloud engineering. I'm driven by automation, scalable architectures, and everything related to containers, CI/CD, and infrastructure as code.

During my university years, I had the chance to do an Erasmus+ exchange at Politechnika Gdańska (Poland), where I deepened my knowledge in cryptography and algorithmics. That international experience shaped the way I work and think.

items.title: Electronic music & mixing
items.description: I'm interested in electronic music and digital sound. I experiment with mixing as a form of technical creativity, using a Pioneer DDJ-FLX4.

items.title: Illustration
items.description: I draw manga and caricatures as a creative counterpoint to technical work. Pen and paper remain a great way to disconnect.

items.title: Gaming
items.description: Gamer in my spare time. I especially enjoy games with solid progression systems and well-crafted narratives.

description: Building end-to-end data pipelines in Microsoft Fabric using PySpark to transform and integrate operational data.
Designing and maintaining Lakehouses and Semantic Models for self-service analytics.
Delivering Power BI dashboards consumed by business stakeholders across the organization.
Worked with Spark, PySpark, Hive, and SQL for ETL processes and data analytics.
Contributed to scalable data solutions and data lake maintenance.
Collaborated with agile teams to deliver data-driven solutions for clients.

items.details: 369 ECTS. Key courses: Statistics, Data Management, Virtual Infrastructure (CI/CD), Differential Equations.

awards.title: Awards
items: Recognition of Academic Record, City Council of San Fernando (2019)

items.name: vASCA-R
items.description: R implementation of the VASCA algorithm for variable selection in high-dimensional datasets, particularly useful in biomarker discovery for genomic studies. Developed as my Bachelor's Thesis.

items.name: Logistics Routes
items.description: Delivery route optimization app in Go considering traffic, vehicle dimensions, and priority constraints. Passed with honors in Virtual Infrastructure (UGR).

blog.title: Blog
blog.empty: Coming soon. I'm preparing my first posts.
